name: Ibis Barcelona Cornella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and helpful Staff. Room was quadruple glazed so no problem with noise but we would have liked coffee/tea making facilities in the room. Free and secure parking was a big plus for us. The area is commercial/industrial so not pretty on the eye whilst walking (10 minutes) or driving to Almeda station (FCG). At the station we bought a T10 ticket for less than 8 euros (correct money needed or use a credit card) for ten journeys on FCG, metro, buses, tram or RENFE. Roadworks including closed exits and detours at the A2 motorway junction made life difficult.
reviews.title: Great if your touring

reviews.text: For a budget priced stay in Barcelona with free parking you can't beat this. Book in advance and you get a cheaper price, although we had to cancel and change our dates so lost that and ended up paying the flat rate of 69 euros a night.
reviews.title: Loved the beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in a group of 2 couples for 3 nights on a bike tour, needing the free parking for the bikes. the rooms were very clean and beds extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Ibis

likes.disliked: — Location and no breakfast included in the price

reviews.text: We did have issues with the air con, with temps of 40 degrees we specifically asked to make sure they had air con. my sister rooms stopped working the 1st night, and the 2nd day the hotel had hot water problems and there was no hot water, and what did come out the tap was disgustingly black, but the cold was still on. The problem laster for about 5 hours in total.....and they did do their best to fix it ( they have a 15 minute satisfaction promise other wise the room is on them for the night).
reviews.title: Worst Ibis i ever been

reviews.text: The same day there was problems with the water our rooms air con stopped working altogether. Our air con problems caused us to change rooms ( they had'nt linked it to the water problems at that time). And the air con worked in the new room when we changed but during that night it stopped working. Keep in mind that they give you duvets to sleep under and on the first night we used these with the air con but there was no way you could sleep at all without the A/C, as you can't easily have the windows open as they were huge massive double glazed ones which both opened into the rooms.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Visiting Barcelona at the time of big conventions, can cause headache, when trying to find the right and available accomodation.
reviews.title: Keep it secret for your next convention trip

aka: Ibis Barcelona Cornella Hotel Cornella De Llobregat
description: The Ibis Barcelona Cornella hotel is located in Cornella de Llobregat, a suburb of Barcelona, 5 min by car from the airport and 10 min from the centre. Easily accessible from the A2 motorway A2, it has 122 air-conditioned rooms, including 4 fitted out for disabled guests. It has a restaurant, a bar open 24/24 and closed free private parking. Guests on a business trip will appreciate the meeting room and Wifi wireless Internet connection.
